A specialization in Strategy provides a necessary foundation for tomorrow’s business leaders.     Sample courses:                           Advanced Strategic Analysis       Competitive Strategy in the Marketplace       Corporate Governance       Strategic Design                           Globalization: A Cross-Functional Perspective       Strategic Talent Management       Operations Strategy       Service Operations and Strategy                        Please note that this is a selection of courses and is subject to change. For more information, visit the course index . / Print                Print      Email      Share       Like                                              Strategy Specialization   The goal of a successful strategy is the alignment of a firm’s internal resources and capabilities with external market opportunities to sustain an advantage relative to rivals. The strategy specialization is designed for students who will pursue careers in strategy consulting or corporate strategic planning departments. Careers oriented toward general business management, entrepreneurship, and investment banking also will benefit from greater depth in strategy coursework. The courses in this specialization provide students with cutting-edge theories and practice on such topics as value creation and capture, external analysis of industries, internal analysis of a firm’s competitive strengths and weaknesses, competitive positioning, multimarket and corporate strategy, strategic decision-making, and strategy implementation.    Academic Advisor: Professor Melissa Schilling     Course List   REQUIRED:  Full-time students who select the Strategy specialization must also complete COR1-GB.2301: Strategy in addition to 9.0 credits from the list below:                 FINC-GB.2304      Restructuring Firms and Industries              INFO-GB.2318      Digital Strategy              INFO-GB.3155      Global Sourcing and Open Innovation              INFO-GB.3355      Globalization, Open Innovation, and Crowdsourcing: New Ways of Organizing              INTA-GB.2306      Business Drivers of Industries              MGMT-GB.2176      Corporate Governance              MGMT-GB.2185      The Globalization of Business Enterprise              MGMT-GB.2313      The Strategist              MGMT-GB.2327      Managing the Growing Company              MGMT-GB.2340      Global Strategy              MGMT-GB.2353      Managing Change              MGMT-GB.2366      Global Social Impact Strategy              MGMT-GB.2368      Strategy with a Social Purpose              MGMT-GB.2370      Strategic Design              MGMT-GB.2375      Advanced Strategy: Tools              MGMT-GB.2383      Strategic Talent Management              MGMT-GB.3105      Consulting Practice: Processes & Problem-Solving              MGMT-GB.3140      Moneyball for Managers: Strategizing in a Complex World              MGMT-GB.3155      Technology Innovation Strategy              MGMT-GB.3319      Strategies: Mergers and Acquisitions              MGMT-GB.3323      Game Theory              MGMT-GB.3328      Advanced Strategic Analysis              MGMT-GB.3356      Managing by Design              MKTG-GB.2153      Pricing              MKTG-GB.2353      Pricing              MKTG-GB.2361      Competitive Strategy in the Marketplace              OPMG-GB.3355      Operations Strategy              OPMG-GB.3357      Service Operations and Strategy             Maximum of 3 credits from this set:              ECON-GB.2110      Economics of Healthcare              ECON-GB.2119      Entertainment and Media: Markets and Economics              ECON-GB.2345      The Business of Social and Other Networks              ECON-GB.2360      Sports Economics              FINC-GB.2310      Managing Financial Businesses              MKTG-GB.2119      Entertainment and Media Industries              MKTG-GB.2315      Business of Broadcast & Cable TV              MKTG-GB.2375      Retail Strategy             For course descriptions, please see the Office of Records & Registration website . Apply Now        Request Information        Events                                                                                 Graduate Certificate in Strategy and Leadership          feature subtitle 1          feature text                             The Graduate Certificate in Strategy and Leadership addresses the need for managers and business leaders in the 21st century to set clear objectives with a competitive strategic advantage; to motivate employees; and to redevelop a culture of trust, integrity, and profitability in the global, customer-centric marketplace.   This six-course, 18-credit graduate certificate program provides excellent preparation for individuals who need to stay abreast of the continuously evolving needs of the industry.   The program can be completed fully online, or in a traditional classroom setting, or by blending a combination of the two formats. Upon completion of this certificate, you may apply for entrance into the Master of Science in Management and Systems . Graduate certificate courses may be used to satisfy some requirements for this master's degree. The majority of students in the Graduate Certificate in Strategy and Leadership transfer into the degree program.
